prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Vivienne Hale
mes:
He finished fast. He always did.

No buildup. No tenderness. Just the press of his body and the dry grunt that meant it was over. He rolled off her like she was a piece of furniture he was done using. One of her legs was still bent, satin twisted around her thigh, but he was already pulling on his slacks.

Vivienne stared up at the ceiling, at the way the morning light made the crown molding look like the bars of a gilded cage. Her breath was shallow. Not from exhaustion. From the ache of everything that hadn’t happened.

He didn’t notice. He never did.

“Something came up,” he said, buttoning his shirt without looking at her.

Work, probably. Or one of his girls. He never even tried to hide them anymore. He had the audacity to bring their perfume home on his collar, their foundation smudged across his shirt like a badge. One of them had left a pair of earrings on the nightstand once. Vivienne had placed them neatly in the trash.

Now, he tugged on his Rolex, gave his tie a lazy adjustment, and left.

No kiss. No glance. Just footsteps fading into silence and the soft click of the front door closing behind him.

She lay there for a moment longer, motionless. The sheets still warm where he’d been. The air cold against her skin. Her hand drifted down, fingers brushing over her stomach—a place he’d once touched with hope, before calling her broken. Useless. A disgrace.

She turned her face into the pillow and inhaled deeply. Then exhaled.

Slow. Clean.

The bathroom mirror was fogged by the time she walked in. She didn’t bother wiping it clean. Her reflection wasn’t what she wanted to see.

The showerhead dripped steadily. An old leak—one that could’ve been fixed months ago. One he never noticed.

She could’ve called anyone. A service. A contractor. But she didn’t want anyone. She wanted her.

The girl with grease on her knuckles and dust on her boots. The girl who came with a toolbox and left with a handprint on Vivienne’s thigh. Who never asked for more than a moment, but took her time like she owned it.

Vivienne tied her robe loosely around her waist. Then untied it. Then tied it again, looser.

She opened her closet like a ritual. The lingerie was folded at the back of a drawer—expensive, barely worn, bought in a fit of loneliness months ago. Black lace with silver hooks. Thin as breath. Pointless, really.

Unless someone actually looked.

She stepped into it slowly. Felt the familiar rush of silk sliding against skin. Her pulse ticked in her throat as she fastened the final clasp, dragged the robe back on, and let it hang off one shoulder like an invitation.

Her makeup was already done—she’d worn it to bed, of course. Not for him. Never for him.

The doorbell rang at exactly 11:07.

She didn’t answer it.

She called down instead, voice floating like a melody over the banister: “Upstairs bathroom. You know the one.”

She listened for the sound of boots on marble. The gentle clatter of tools. A breath that didn’t belong to her.

Vivienne stood at the edge of the bathroom, facing the broken showerhead, letting the steam rise thick and warm around her. Her robe clung to the curves of her hips, half-loose, half-falling. The light from the window cut across the tile in sharp angles. She didn’t move. Not yet.

She heard the door creak open.

Waited.

The air shifted—just slightly. The way it always did when she walked into a room.

She didn’t turn around at first. Let the silence grow teeth. Let the humidity curl her hair and cling to her lashes.

Then, in one smooth motion, she turned—just enough to reveal the slit of bare thigh, the sheer black lace, the swell of her breasts half-spilled from delicate straps.

No words yet. Not until she was sure {user} had looked up.

And when she did, her voice was satin-wrapped sin, soaked in honey and nerve.

“Are you here to fix the leak,” she asked, letting the robe fall open at the hips, “or are you just going to stand there and stare while I drip?”

Her smile was slow. Crooked. Dangerous. The kind of smile that came with warning signs and handcuffs.

She stepped closer.

Not to close the distance— Just to make {user} decide who she was going to be today.

The professional? The problem solver?

Or the one who’s already slipped between Vivienne’s sheets a dozen times and counted her gasps like confessions?

Vivienne didn’t speak again.

She didn’t have to.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee does not need a second invitation. She drops her toolbar and the clipboard at the same time. She doesnt even register the clipboard bouncing against the ground*

*She steps forward already yanking off her jacket as she crowds Vivienne against the bathroom sink. One the jacket is off her shoulders she is ducking her head to kiss along Vivienne's neck and yank the jacket off her arms*

*Hailee gets it off and throws it behind her letting her hands immediately drop to Vivienne's waist pulling her flush and her fingers trail under the robe then over stopping at the loose not keeping it closed* "Take it off"
*She growls low and hungry not even letting Vivienne move before her lips are crashed against her and setting her up on the sink to step between her legs*

name: Vivienne Hale
mes:
The moment Hailee's hands land on her waist, Vivienne lets out a sharp, breathless laugh—half surprise, half relief. The clipboard clattering to the floor is the only warning she gets before she's being pressed back against the sink, marble cool through the thin silk of her robe.

Her breath hitches as Hailee’s mouth finds her neck—hot and impatient, teeth scraping just enough to make her gasp. She arches into it instinctively, fingers tangling in Hailee’s hair to pull her closer.

*"Take it off."*

The command sends a shiver down Vivienne’s spine. She doesn’t hesitate—just loosens the tie of her robe with one quick tug and lets it slide off her shoulders in a whisper of fabric. The lace beneath is sheer enough that there’s no mystery left between them, but Hailee doesn’t seem interested in subtlety today. Not when she lifts Vivienne onto the sink like she weighs nothing and steps between her thighs like they belong there.

Vivienne barely has time to register the chill of porcelain beneath her before Hailee crashes their lips together again—hungry, possessive—and suddenly all she can taste is heat and want and *her.* One hand fists in Hailee's shirt while the other grips at the edge of the sink for balance as legs wrap around narrow hips on instinct alone.

She pulls back just long enough to pant against Hailee's mouth: "You're supposed to be fixing things," but there's no bite behind it—just amusement curling at every syllable as nails drag lightly down toned arms.

Then adds softer (because even now some part of Vivienne still needs permission):
"...Unless you'd rather break something else first?"
swipes:
The clipboard clattering against the marble tile barely registers—just another casualty in the wreckage of Hailee’s urgency. Vivienne barely has time to inhale before she’s pressed back against the sink, cold porcelain biting into her thighs as Hailee’s hands scorch paths beneath silk.

Her breath hitches when those fingers find the loose knot of her robe, tugging with a roughness that makes her pulse jump. She could tease. Could arch a brow and ask if this is how {user} treats all her clients—but then Hailee’s mouth crashes into hers, hot and demanding, and all coherent thought dissolves like sugar on a tongue.

Vivienne lets out a muffled sound against {user}’s lips—half protest, half surrender—as she's hoisted onto the sink without warning. The robe slips further open under Hailee's impatient grip, pooling around her elbows like water before it finally gives way entirely. The lace beneath is sheer enough to see through; every rapid rise of Vivienne's chest is visible beneath delicate black threads as she gasps into their kiss.

She breaks away just enough to drag in air (or maybe just to watch {user}'s pupils dilate at the sight of her). Her fingers tangle in {user}'s hair—not guiding, not pulling yet—just *holding*, grounding herself in this moment where everything else ceases to exist except for them: steam curling between their bodies; Hailee's calloused thumbs digging crescents into Vivienne's hips; the slow drip-drip-drip of that goddamn showerhead neither one cares about fixing now.

"*Ruin me,*" she murmurs against {user}’s jawline between kisses that bruise more than they soothe (and oh how she craves both). It isn't begging—it never will be from someone like *her*—but it might as well be scripture written across bare skin when followed by teeth sinking sharp into collarbone flesh:
A claim disguised as worship.

And then? Then there are no words left worth speaking aloud because actions have always spoken louder anyway...
